title: tie strength

title: strong ties
description: strong ties lead to integration or regulation

title: weak ties

title: alter attributes
description: alter attributes are called composition and it reflects content, resources, behaviors, cultural characteristics

title: social influence
description: social influence is a major theme of alter attributes

title: access to social capital is a major theme of alter attributes
description: access to social capital is a major theme of alter attributes

description: broader patterns of interaction in society is a major theme of alter attributes

description: ego-alter similarity

title: homophily
description: preference is when people tend to socialize and form bonds with others like them or homophily

title: availability
description: availability is when people tend to socialize and form bonds with people they come into contact with

title: influence
description: influence is when people become more similar over time through repeated social interactions

title: applies only to achieved statuses (e.g. attitudes, decisions, behaviors), not ascribed ones (e.g. race, gender)
description: applies only to achieved statuses (e.g. attitudes, decisions, behaviors), not ascribed ones (e.g. race, gender)

title: homophily insulates ego from outside influence and ideas and reinforces in-group behaviors and biases
description: homophily insulates ego from outside influence and ideas and reinforces in-group behaviors and biases

title: identity-affirming, fostering a sense of comfort and belonging
description: identity-affirming, fostering a sense of comfort and belonging

title: can be used to impute ego characteristics
description: can be used to impute ego characteristics

title: can measure social influence over time
description: can measure social influence over time

title: categorical
description: categorical

description: continuous

title: average euclidean distance
description: average euclidean distance is just standard deviation with deviation around the ego

title: heterogeneity
description: heterogeneity or range is the similarity of alters to each other rather than to ego

title: range of non-redundant social resources may be good and participation in diverse social spheres
description: range of non-redundant social resources may be good and participation in diverse social spheres

title: Blau's Index
description: categorical heterogeneity most common measure is blau's index is the probability that two randomly selected individuals from a group belong to different categories, where ranges from 0-1 with higher scores indicating more heterogeneity

title: Agresti's Index of Qualitative Variation (IQV)
description: Agresti's Index of Qualitative Variation (IQV) is just a normalized version of Blau's index, 1 is equal dispersion

title: standard deviation across the distribution of alters
description: continuous heterogeneity can be the standard deviation across the distribution of alters

title: alter-alter ties
description: alter-alter ties

title: ties may be binary or valued
description: ties may be binary or valued

title: info about ties or lack of ties between alters is essential for computing all good measures of network structure
description: info about ties or lack of ties between alters is essential for computing all good measures of network structure

title: usually we are interested in operationalizing outcomes or characteristics of structural holes
description: usually we are interested in operationalizing outcomes or characteristics of structural holes

title: structural holes
description: structural holes is the absence of a tie between two alters

title: operationalizes information
description: operationalizes information, meaning the more everyone knows every0ne else, the more likely information is redundant

title: operationalizes power
description: operationalizes power, meaning an ego who bridges two networks is able to control the flow of information and resources between them, and is less constrained by those alters

title: Coleman's closure or transitivity
description: Coleman's closure is the triadic closure or transitivity

title: closure and social capital
description: Coleman associated closure with social capital (1988)

title: shared social norms in a closure effectively guide the actions of an individual
description: shared social norms that effectively guide the actions of an individual, interpersonal trust, obligation to group members, cohesion, cooperation

title: same mechanism of constraint may be beneficial or not depending on context
description: same mechanism of constraint may be beneficial or not depending on context

title: density
description: density is how many ego's alters are connected, controlling for network size

title: strength of social safety net
description: strength of social safety net

title: strength of normative pressure to conform
description: strength of normative pressure to conform

title: very powerful in combo with composition (direction of push)
description: very powerful in combo with composition (direction of push)

title: more redundancy of info and resources (lack of structural holes)
description: more redundancy of info and resources (lack of structural holes)

title: redundancy
description: redundancy is ties where alters can be reached through multiple direct and indirect pathways

title: actual ties/potential ties is how to calculate
description: actual ties/potential ties is how to calculate

title: effective size
description: effective size is if ego has ties to alters who are tied to each other there is lots of redundancy

title: effective size conveys something about ego's total impact
description: effective size conveys something about ego's total impact

title: measurement of effective size
description: effective size is just ego's number of alters minus the average number of ties that each alter has to other alters

title: effective size is a positive function of network size and a negative function of the number of ties among alters
description: effective size is a positive function of network size and a negative function of the number of ties among alters

title: efficiency
description: efficiency is similar to effective size except that it is normed by actual size (degree) i.e. what proportion of ego's ties to alters are non-redundant

title: constraint
description: constraint is a measure that taps the extent to which ego's ties are to alters who are connected to one another

title: egos with more ties might actually be losing freedom instead of gaining because network deensity is increasing
description: egos with more ties might actually be losing freedom instead of gaining because network deensity is increasing
